text: After 3 years of extremely rough use knockoff Chinese wireless Bluetooth earbud kicked the bucket. Earbud, because one of them still work(and people say Chinese tech is poorly made). At the time of buying those knockoff earbuds it was around the same price as these One Plus Nord Buds 2 price range, actually I believe it was slightly cheaper(I cannot for the life of me remember). I am not a heavy earbuds user, I mostly use it to listen to podcasts in the morning and pair it with my laptop to listen to music while I work at night. The buds seldom leave the vicinity of my work desk at home, no exposure to the elements of nature and no exposure to sweat. I clean my earbuds regularly. That being said I do listen to a wide range of music, I'm no audiophile, but can identify change in quality in the listening device.With that in mind, these earbuds offer an okay sound quality, hence why I gave it 4 stars, the sound quality is clear and don't have much noise, the trebles are well balanced so as to not rupture your eardrums, but the bass is overblown which is why I gave it 3 stars. The bass drowns out the other sounds, and overwhelms your ear. Especially if you are listening to an orchestral piece, you'll struggle appreciate the individual artists. This can be solved with software to a certain extent. By using the "HeyMelody" app you can configure your OnePlus Nord Buds 2. You can use pre configured sound profiles like Balanced, Bold, Serenade, or Bass. There is also the BassWave option which allows you to adjust the clarity and fidelity of the bass via software. If you are still unsatisfied you can configure your own custom profile by adding an equalizer and creating the ideal audio setup.Now one of the more attractive feature of these buds I have seen from other buyers is the ANC at this price point. Honestly I don't really use the feature that much, mostly because I like to be aware of my surroundings and not get completely immersed in whatever I'm doing on the computer/phone. But the ANC works kinda well? I mean it's not the same as Apple's ANC, but for 3k you should temper your expectations. By holding down on the touch gesture surface on the ear buds or by going into the app on your phone you can enable ANC. It was able to completely tune out the ambient buzzing sound of my Air Conditioning, which is old and loud, so I think the ANC is very good. The only thing is when there is no audio playing you'll hear a hissing or buzzing sound if you have ANC enabled. It's not super annoying, but that is just my personal opinion.As for battery backup, I have managed to go 2 days without charging the buds, but this is with light usage. It still has 90% left even after I have used it for 2 days so I think the battery backup is good. The case is sturdy and the buds fall into place within the case magnetically. text: Buying a tws headphones can be very confusing given the number of options within the under 5k budget range. I bought the OP Nord buds because I already had a One plus phone and there was a level of trust for the company for the quality of their products. But I was quite disappointed by this purchase so much so that I wanted to return then on the same day I received them. Here's are the pros and cons from my experience.Pros:- Build quality: the build quality is good. It comes in a really nice charging case. It closes with a satisfying snap and the magnets in the case made sure the buds stayed in place in the case.- fit: they fit quite well in the ear. I didn't have any worry about them falling off.- they look good.- instant connectCons:- Really disappointing sound quality: for a product that you're spending so much money on the sound quality was really average. If you like bass you will be really upset. If you're a music lover then you'll feel how the sound quality does no justice to the music.- App support: I bought these because I already had a one plus phone (6T) because I thought connectivity and compatibility will be a breeze. However I got no such thing. The hey melody app, which is there for non-one plus phone users to customise the buds, asks you to go to the phones Bluetooth settings to adjust and customise but the bluetooth settings have no such option. The hey melody app allows for no further customisation.- ears tend to hurt after long term use.I would suggest if you are looking for a good midrange tws earphones you should definitely go for the cheaper alternatives. This one's definitely not worth the money. I am now using Oppo enco buds and they are way better in terms of sound quality and bass and they cost a ₹1000 lesser than these.

text: The OnePlus Nord Buds 2 truly impressed me with their outstanding audio performance. While the Active Noise Cancellation may not be the most powerful, it still effectively reduces surrounding noise, creating a more immersive listening experience.The 12.4mm driver unit sets these earbuds apart from the competition, providing a level of sound clarity and depth that is unparalleled in its price range. The bass quality, enhanced by the BassWave Technology, adds a new dimension to my music, making every beat feel more vibrant and enjoyable.The inclusion of the dedicated app is a fantastic addition, allowing me to fine-tune the sound with the Master Equalizers. Whether I want a balanced sound, emphasize vocals, or seek a transparent audio experience, I can easily adjust the settings to match my preferences for different types of content.With a remarkable battery life of up to 36 hours on a single charge, the OnePlus Nord Buds 2 are perfect for extended use, whether I'm on a long journey or just immersed in my favorite playlists all day long.In conclusion, the OnePlus Nord Buds 2 have proven to be a top-notch choice for anyone seeking a high-quality and customizable audio experience. Despite the moderate ANC, the exceptional sound quality, bass enhancement, and user-friendly app make these earbuds a compelling purchase that I wholeheartedly recommend. They have quickly become my go-to earphones for all my audio needs.One thing to note about the OnePlus Nord Buds 2 is that the case can be quite slippery. While the earbuds themselves fit securely in the case, the smooth exterior can sometimes make it challenging to grip, especially if you're on the move.To address this issue, I highly recommend purchasing a silicon skin for the case. Adding a silicon skin not only provides better grip and handling but also offers additional protection against scratches and minor bumps. It's a practical investment to ensure the safety and longevity of both the earbuds and the case.Overall, with the added silicon skin, the OnePlus Nord Buds 2 become an even more desirable choice, providing an excellent audio experience, customizable features, and now, enhanced practicality and protection for everyday use.
